Detailed Description

Overlay item visual spec class.

All ScreenPoints that are used in this class are referring to the offset relative to the upper left corner of the background image. I.e. ScreenPoint(10,10) refers to the position 10 pixels down and 10 pixels to the right of the upper left corner of the background image.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::TextHorizontalAlignment

Enumeration type for text placement. Concerns horizontal orientation.

Enumerator:
TEXT_HALIGN_LEFT  Horizontal text alignment left.
TEXT_HALIGN_CENTER  Horizontal text alignment center.
TEXT_HALIGN_RIGHT  Horizontal text alignment right.

enum WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::TextVerticalAlignment

Enumeration type for text placement. Concerns vertical orientation.

Enumerator:
TEXT_VALIGN_TOP  Verticval text alignment top.
TEXT_VALIGN_CENTER  Verticval text alignment center.
TEXT_VALIGN_BOTTOM  Verticval text alignment bottom.

Member Function Documentation

static OverlayItemVisualSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::allocate ( const ImageSpec *  backgroundImage,
const ScreenPoint &  focusPoint 
) [static]

Allocates a new visual spec that shows no icon image. Initially the number of text rows are set to 0, if you wish to support text you will need to define a rectangle which will contain the text and the number of text rows.

Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

See also:
setTextProperties.
Parameters:
backgroundImage The background image.
focusPoint The focus point of the image, i.e. this is the point of the image that should be focused on a certain coordinate on the map (i.e. the tip).

static OverlayItemVisualSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::allocate ( const ImageSpec *  backgroundImage,
const ScreenPoint &  focusPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  imgCenterPoint,
wf_uint32  imgId 
) [static]

Allocates a new visual spec. Initially the number of text rows are set to 0, if you wish to support text you will need to define a rectangle which will contain the text and the number of text rows.

See also:
setTextProperties.
Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

Parameters:
backgroundImage The background image.
imgId The image id to use as representation. OverlayItems can have multiple images representing their states, this determines which one to use when drawing.
focusPoint The focus point of the image, i.e. this is the point of the image that should be focused on a certain coordinate on the map (i.e. the tip).
imgCenterPoint The center point of where to put the overlayed image.

void WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::setTextProperties ( const ScreenPoint &  upperLeftPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  lowerRightPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  numberUpperLeftPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  numberLowerRightPoint,
const TextAlignment &  textAlignment,
const TextAlignment &  numberAlignment,
const RGB &  textColor,
const RGB &  nbrColor,
FontSpec *  textFont,
FontSpec *  nbrFont 
)

Set the properties for overlaying text onto the background image. The area of the background image that is used for drawing text pis defined by the rectangle that is formed by the two diagonal ScreenPoints.

Parameters:
upperLeftPoint The upper left point of the rectangle indicating where text will be drawn.
lowerRightPoint The lower right point of the rectangle indicating where text will be drawn.
numberUpperLeftPoint The upper left point of the rectangle indicating where the number of items will be drawn.
numberLowerRightPoint The lower right point of the rectanble indicating where the number of items will be drawn.
textAlignment The alignment for the text.
numberAlignment The alignment for the number of stacked items.
textColor The color that should be used when drawing the text e.g the name of the placemarker.
nbrColor The color that should be used when drawing number of stacked items.
textFont The font for the text area.
nbrFont The font for the number area.

void WFAPI::OverlayItemVisualSpec::setTextProperties ( const ScreenPoint &  upperLeftPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  lowerRightPoint,
const TextAlignment &  textAlignment,
const RGB &  textColor = RGB(0, 0, 0),
FontSpec *  textFont = NULL 
)

Set the properties for overlaying text onto the background image. The area of the background image that is used for drawing text is defined by the rectangle that is formed by the two diagonal ScreenPoints.

Parameters:
upperLeftPoint The upper left point of the rectangle indicating where text will be drawn.
lowerRightPoint The lower right point of the rectangle indicating where text will be drawn.
textAlignment The alignment for the text.
textColor The color that should be used for the text.
textFont The font that should be used for drawing the text. NULL means default font.
